meanings.definition: A trigonometric function that is equal to the sine of the complement of a given angle.
meanings.sent1: In trigonometry, we often use versines to calculate certain angles.
meanings.sent2: The math teacher explained how to find the versines of different angles.
meanings.sent3: The versines at play in the math problem made the students scratch their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of trigonometry was as clear as the versines in a textbook.
meanings.sent5: The concept of versines stuck in my mind after the lesson.

meanings.definition: A line segment perpendicular to the x-axis in a Cartesian coordinate system.
meanings.sent1: The versines on the graph helped us understand the coordinates better.
meanings.sent2: She drew the versines carefully to show the perpendicular lines.
meanings.sent3: The versines on the graph looked like tiny ladders to climb.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the versines in the coordinate system was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The versines on the graph stood out clearly against the background.
